meanings.definition: Twisted or bent out of shape
meanings.sent1: The intorted tree branches looked like they were trying to touch the ground.
meanings.sent2: The artist created an intorted sculpture that seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent3: The intorted balloon animal made the children giggle at the birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Her intorted reasoning led her to believe in strange conspiracy theories.
meanings.sent5: The intorted road sign confused drivers with its twisted arrow.

meanings.sent1: She intorted the truth to avoid getting in trouble.
meanings.sent2: The magician intorted the metal spoon with a flick of his wrist.
meanings.sent3: He intorted his face into a funny expression to make his friends laugh.
meanings.sent4: The writer intorted the plot of the story to surprise the readers.
meanings.sent5: The storm intorted the once straight flag into a tangled mess.

meanings.sent1: The intorted seashell had a beautiful spiral pattern.
meanings.sent2: The intorted staircase in the old castle was both eerie and fascinating.
meanings.sent3: The intorted vines wrapped around the tree like a natural ribbon.
meanings.sent4: Her intorted hair cascaded down her back in a unique twisted style.
meanings.sent5: The intorted tornado in the distance was a terrifying sight.
